intro: Oehmea beneckei, commonly known as the red-flowered hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from red to pink, with five petals that are often adorned with intricate patterns. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are dark green and glossy, providing a striking contrast to its vibrant blooms. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Oehmea beneckei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
